page.title: 19Strensham Footpaths
page.content: There are 14 paths shown on the county surveyors definitive map, only four appear to be still in use. Only two paths have been sign posted. No 13 leaves the Defford road at Bourn Bank bridge and leads to the church as does No 3 which leaves the Defford road at Moat farm and skirts the moat itself, stiles and a footbridge across a dyke have been erected along route 8 which leaves Strensham village, passes close to the lake on Home Farm and extends across open farmland to the village of Naunton. To the east of the village a path leaves the Severn Trent waterworks service road and allegedly passes through Strensham Mill thence along the bank of the Avon to Strensham Lock. Several footpaths were lost when fields were enlarged. Others have been destroyed by the motorways.
